trans-unit.source: Defines the binding element used to create a peer message transport channel.
This transport cannot be used with contracts that have request/reply operations.
Initializes a new default instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.PeerTransportBindingElement"></xref> class.
Creates a channel factory that can be used to create a channel for sending messages.
This method can be used to get a channel factory based on the configuration of the transport binding element.
<xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.BindingContext"></xref> that specifies the binding context for the channel factory.
The type of channel to produce.
<xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.IChannelFactory"></xref> that contains the new channel factory of the specified type.
The context parameter is set to `null`.
Manual addressing was specified in the binding context for this channel factory.
The channel type indicated by this binding context is not supported.
Creates a channel listener of the specified type for receiving messages.
This method can be used to get a channel listener for receiving messages based on the configuration of the transport binding element.
<xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.BindingContext"></xref> that specifies the binding context for the channel listener.
<xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.IChannel"></xref> that specifies the type of the channels to produce.
<xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.IChannelListener"></xref> that contains the new channel listener of the specified type.
The context parameter is set to `null`.
The channel type indicated by this binding context is not supported.
Determines whether a channel factory of the specified type can be built.
<xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.BindingContext"></xref> that specifies the binding context for the channel factory.
<xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.IChannel"></xref> that specifies the type of the channels to produce.
`true` if this binding element can produce a channel factory of the specified type; `false` if it cannot.
Determines whether a channel listener of the specified type can be built.
<xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.BindingContext"></xref> that specifies the binding context for the channel listener.
<xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.IChannel"></xref> that specifies the type of the channel listener.
`true` if this binding element can produce a channel listener of the specified type; `false` if it cannot.
Creates a copy of the current binding element.
The object returned by this method can be re-boxed as an object of the more specific <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.PeerTransportBindingElement> type.
<xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.BindingElement"></xref> that contains a copy of the current binding element.
Returns a property from the specified <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.BindingContext"></xref> object.
The following properties can be retrieved from <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.PeerTransportBindingElement>:
<xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.BindingContext"></xref> that specifies the binding context.
The specific property to obtain from the binding context.
The property from the specified <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.BindingContext"></xref>.
Gets and sets the IP address on which peer message transports created by this binding element listen.
<xref href="System.Net.IPAddress"></xref> that contains the IP address on which peer message transports created by this binding element listen.
Gets and sets the value that specifies the maximum size, in bytes, of messages sent over transport channels created by this binding element.
The default message size is 65,536 bytes.
The maximum size of messages sent over transport channels created by this binding element.
Gets and sets the network port on which peer message transport channels created by this binding element listen.
If a port is not specified, then a port number is chosen from the set of available dynamic ports.
The network port on which peer message transports created by this binding element listen.
Gets the scheme used to indicate the protocol over which messages are transported by channels created by this binding element.
The default value for this property is "p2p".
The scheme for the protocol over which messages are transported by channels created by this binding element.
Gets the specific security settings for transport channels created by this binding element.
<xref href="System.ServiceModel.PeerSecuritySettings"></xref> that specifies the specific security settings for transport channels created by this binding element.
Writes custom peer transport channel elements into the generated metadata for an endpoint.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataExporter"></xref> that exports the metadata information.
A <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.WsdlContractConversionContext"></xref> object that provides mappings from exported WSDL elements to the contract description.
Writes custom peer transport channel elements into the generated WSDL for a contract.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.WsdlExporter"></xref> that exports the contract information.
A <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.WsdlContractConversionContext"></xref> object that provides mappings from exported WSDL elements to the contract description.
Writes custom peer transport channel elements into the generated WSDL for an endpoint.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.WsdlExporter"></xref> that exports the endpoint information.
A <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.WsdlEndpointConversionContext"></xref> object that provides mappings from exported WSDL elements to the endpoint description.
context is `null`.
